column1: COLON CANCER SCREEN Until age 75, you should be screened for colorectal cancer.
DIABETES SCREENING - If you are age 65 or older and in good health, you should be screened for diabetes every 3 years.
Others recommend mammography for women in good health.
- Ask your provider which exercises can help prevent osteoporosis.

PELVIC EXAM AND PAP SMEAR - After age 65, most women who have not been diagnosed with cervical cancer or precancer can stop having Pap smears as long as they have had 3 negative tests within the past 10 years.
